Summary Note:
Schwarz Becker Scholz and the RM are cousins, having grown up together in Berlin. Their familial bond has naturally extended into a professional partnership built on mutual respect and shared values.
Having worked for over 43 years, Schwarz Becker Scholz brings a wealth of experience and expertise to his current role. He is known for his strategic thinking and ability to drive results.
Julius Baer's personalized approach and dedication to client success were key factors in his decision to join.
Family Background: Schwarz Becker Scholz is currently widowed. His child is named Uhlig.
Education Background:
In 1977, Schwarz graduated from Maria-Theresia-Gymnasium München with a secondary school diploma.
He then attended University of Berlin, which he graduated in 1981.
Occupation History:
Schwarz Becker Scholz is a 66 year old retired Family Office Executive from Germany. He has a diverse background, having worked in various capacities and gained extensive knowledge in the field.
Schwarz Becker Scholz's first role was as a Financial Advisor at Credit Suisse (Deutschland) AG, where he worked diligently from 1982 to 1986 to establish a strong reputation.
In 1986, he moved to Commerzbank Private Banking to work as a Portfolio Manager, applying his knowledge to achieve outstanding performance.
At Deutsche Bank Private Wealth Management, he worked as a Wealth Manager from 1988 to 1989, focusing on strategic initiatives and team collaboration.
After 7 years of dedication, he assumed the role of Family Office Executive at Credit Suisse (Deutschland) AG in 1990, spearheading high-profile projects and mentoring junior colleagues.
Wealth Summary:
While working, he saved 2160000 EUR, which he used to build a diversified investment portfolio.
His remarkable portfolio comprises 2 stunning properties. Situated in prime locations across Hamburg and Düsseldorf, these assets demonstrate their sophisticated understanding of real estate investments and high-end lifestyle preferences.
He does not have any inheritances.
Client Summary: In conclusion, we are confident in the client's financial stability and future prospects.
